abstract: The giant discount retailer said that, after it introduced a revised health plan last fall, the number of workers who signed up reached 50.2 percent of its 1.4 million employees.
snippet: The giant discount retailer said that, after it introduced a revised health plan last fall, the number of workers who signed up reached 50.2 percent of its 1.4 million employees.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart Stores, the nation’s largest private employer, said on Tuesday that for the first time in its 45-year history more than half of its workers had enrolled in the company’s health insurance plan, a potent milestone for a retailer long associated with unaffordable benefits.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Says Most Workers Have Health Plan
